title: Live results: 2025 Boston mayoral preliminary election
author: John Waller
bullets: Preliminary election narrows Boston mayoral candidates from four to two, including Mayor Michelle Wu, Josh Kraft, Robert Cappucci, and Domingos DaRosa.
Mayor Michelle Wu leads in polls with a significant 50-point advantage over her closest challenger, Josh Kraft.
Election results will determine which two candidates move forward to the final mayoral election in Boston.

title: Survey says Mass. is happy, but not TOO happy. How about you?
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the ninth happiest state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's happiness ranking.
The study evaluated 30 metrics like depression rate, productivity, income growth, and unemployment rate.
Massachusetts ranked 6th in 'Work Environment' and 8th in 'Emotional & Physical Well-Being', but 31st in 'Community & Environment'.

title: After 2024 chaos, Boston’s polling places are stocked with extra ballots
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston's election department is under state control due to last year's ballot shortage during the November election.
Secretary of State William Galvin initiated changes including extra ballots and Poll Pads for smooth elections in 275 polling locations.
Improved communication systems have been implemented following issues with overwhelmed phone lines on Election Day 2024.

title: Man charged in unprovoked attack of woman walking in the South End
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Jose Edgardo Miranda-Martinez, 62, charged with assault and disorderly conduct in a South End attack.
Victim reported being punched multiple times and remained at the scene with notable facial injuries.
Miranda-Martinez allegedly claimed the assault was to stop an unspecified 'game' against him.

title: Report: Four of Bill Belichick’s trademark applications have been denied
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick's four trademark applications were denied due to similarity with existing Patriots trademarks.
The trademarks included versions of 'Do Your Job', 'Ignore the Noise', 'The Belestrator', and 'No Days Off'.
TCE Rights Management can appeal the decision within three months; 'Gold Digger' is still under examination.

title: Spike Lee explained why he has ‘respect for the Red Sox’ despite being constantly trolled by fans
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Spike Lee regularly receives golf balls with 'Yankees suck' messages at his Martha's Vineyard home from Red Sox fans.
Despite fan trolling, Lee respects the Red Sox for inviting him to throw out a first pitch at Fenway Park.
Lee hinted at his fun interaction with Boston fans, especially after a Knicks playoff win against the Celtics in 2025.

title: Man charged with exposing himself at a busy Mass. McDonald’s as a child’s birthday party was happening
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Christopher Lloyd Blake, 36, was charged with exposing himself at a Raynham McDonald's during a child's birthday party.
Blake allegedly appeared highly intoxicated and exposed himself again in a holding cell after resisting arrest.
He pleaded not guilty to charges including open lewdness and is set to reappear in court on September 25.

title: A (mostly) student-friendly food guide to Greater Boston
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Boston.com's guide lists student-friendly bars and restaurants in Greater Boston, catering to the large college demographic.
Recommendations include Felipe’s for late-night eats, Shy Bird for chicken nuggets, and Trident's blend of coffee and book browsing.
For non-students, options like Saloon in Davis and haley.henry wine bar offer quieter spots away from college crowds.

title: Massachusetts unveils finalists for state flag, motto, and seal — which gets your vote?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Massachusetts reveals finalists for new state flag, seal, and motto, seeking public input on three options each.
Flag designs incorporate elements like the state flower, a circle of feathers, and coastal symbols reflecting Massachusetts' identity.
Motto contenders include Latin phrases honoring the state’s communal and historical values, highlighting Indigenous heritage and public good.

title: Mass. actually had 4 tornadoes Saturday, says National Weather Service
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Four EF1 tornadoes were confirmed in Central Massachusetts by the National Weather Service on Saturday.
Tornadoes touched down in Paxton, Holden, Berlin, and Stow, linked to a severe thunderstorm.
The NWS is conducting surveys to determine the tornadoes' tracks and widths; a full report is pending.
